document.title: Building Trust into OO Components Using a Genetic Analogy
document.abstract: Despite the growing interest for component-based systems, few works tackle the question of the trust we can bring into a component.

author.name: Benoit Baudry
author.address: IRISA, Campus Universitaire de Beaulieu, 35042 Rennes Cedex, France

citation.title: Selftestable components: from pragmatic tests to a designfor-testability methodology
citation.raw: Y. Le Traon, D. Deveaux and J-M. Jézéquel, “Selftestable components: from pragmatic tests to a designfor-testability methodology,” In proc. of TOOLSEurope’99. TOOLS, June 1999, Nancy (France) 96-107.

citation.title: Software Trustability
citation.venue: In proc. of the IEEE Symposium on Adaptive processes- Decision and Control, XVII

citation.title: Applying ``design by contract

citation.title: Hints on Test Data Selection : Help For The Practicing Programmer

citation.title: The Revealing Power of a Test Case
citation.raw: J. Voas et K. Miller, “The Revealing Power of a Test Case”, Software Testing, Verification and Reliability, vol. 2, pp. 25-42, 1992.

citation.title: Constraint-Based Automatic Test Data Generation
citation.raw: R. DeMillo et A. Offutt, “Constraint-Based Automatic Test Data Generation”, IEEE Transactions On Computers, vol. 17, pp. 900-910, 1991.

citation.title: Eyres, “Automatic structural testing using genetic algorithms

citation.title: Exploring cost and reliability tradeoffs in architectural alternatives using a genetic algorithm
